cyclone.name: FRED
cyclone.current_location: about 235 miles south of Panama City, Florida and 190 miles west-southwest of Tampa, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving north-northwest, forecast to turn north on Monday and make landfall in the western Florida Panhandle, then track inland across Alabama and Georgia
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: western Florida Panhandle (near Panama City/Apalachicola area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch from the Alabama/Florida border to Navarre, FL
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning from Navarre to the Wakulla/Jefferson County line; Storm Surge Warning Indian Pass to Yankeetown, FL
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from Alabama eastward through the Florida Big Bend and Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Occasional gusts 20–30 mph possible Monday night into Tuesday
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected on the Atlantic side near Jacksonville
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of rain Monday-Tuesday with local totals 1–3 inches; isolated heavier bands possible
weather_observation.other_hazards: Low tornado risk can’t be ruled out inland but overall threat is minimal for the port
